stateCompliance.headline: California Payday Loan Regulations
stateCompliance.intro: Residents of Santa Ana are protected by California's strict payday loan regulations enforced by the Department of Financial Protection and Innovation (DFPI).
stateCompliance.content: California regulates payday loans under the California Deferred Deposit Transaction Law (CDDTL), administered by the Department of Financial Protection and Innovation (DFPI). The state allows payday loans with significant consumer protections: loans are capped at $300 with a maximum fee of 15% (approximately $45). Rollovers are prohibited, meaning lenders cannot issue a new loan to pay off an existing one. California also prohibits lenders from making multiple loans to the same borrower simultaneously. All payday lenders operating in California must be licensed by the DFPI, and consumers can verify a lender's license status online or by calling 1-866-275-2677.
keyPoints: California limits payday loans to a maximum of $300
The maximum fee is 15% of the check amount (up to $45)
Lenders cannot make a new loan to pay off an existing loan (rollovers prohibited)
You cannot have more than one payday loan at a time
If your check bounces, the lender can charge only one NSF fee of up to $15
Lenders cannot threaten criminal prosecution for non-payment
Your loan contract must be provided in your primary language
All lenders must be licensed - verify at dfpi.ca.gov
protections: Maximum fee: 15% of check face value ($45 maximum)
Criminal prosecution: Cannot be threatened for non-payment

regulatoryBody.name: Department of Financial Protection and Innovation

stateCompliance.aprDisclosure: The typical Annual Percentage Rate (APR) for a payday loan in California is approximately 426-460% for a two-week loan. By comparison, credit cards typically have APRs between 15-30% and personal loans between 6-36%. The high APR reflects the short-term nature of payday loans and the fees charged. A $300 payday loan with a $45 fee repaid in 14 days has an APR of approximately 391%.
stateCompliance.disclaimer: IMPORTANT NOTICE: This information is provided for general educational purposes only and does not constitute legal or financial advice. Payday loans are high-cost, short-term loans with APRs that can exceed 400%. Before taking out a payday loan, consider alternatives such as personal loans, credit union loans, payment plans with creditors, or assistance from non-profit credit counseling agencies. Laws and regulations may change. For the most current information, contact the California Department of Financial Protection and Innovation at 1-866-275-2677 or visit dfpi.ca.gov. If you are experiencing financial difficulties, contact a HUD-approved housing counselor or the National Foundation for Credit Counseling at 1-800-388-2227.

faq.question: Where is your Santa Ana location?
faq.answer: Our Santa Ana branch is located at 1505 North Main Street, Suite 110, in downtown Santa Ana. We are near the Bowers Museum. From I-5, take Exit 107 (Downtown) and head east. From CA-55, use Exit 8 (Main Street).

faq.question: What are your hours in Santa Ana?
faq.answer: We are open Monday through Friday from 9 AM to 7 PM, and Saturday from 10 AM to 4 PM. We are closed on Sundays.

faq.question: Do you have Spanish-speaking staff in Santa Ana?
faq.answer: Yes, our Santa Ana location has bilingual staff members who can assist you in Spanish. California law also requires that your loan contract be provided in your primary language.

faq.question: How much can I borrow at your Santa Ana location?
faq.answer: In California, payday loans are limited to $300 maximum by state law. After the maximum fee of $45, you would receive approximately $255. We also offer other loan products like installment loans for larger amounts.

faq.question: What do I need to bring to the Santa Ana branch?
faq.answer: Please bring a valid government-issued photo ID, proof of income (pay stub or bank statement), an active checking account, and a working phone number. Our staff will guide you through the rest of the process.

faq.question: Can I get same-day funding in Santa Ana?
faq.answer: Yes, if you apply in-store and are approved, you can receive your funds the same day. For online applications, we offer next-business-day funding or instant funding to a debit card where available.
